title: Your Feedback in Action: SR and ARAM

replies.body:
Please at least give us the option to disable non-essential animations when the final product comes out. I'm not in on the alpha testing, but my client takes almost as many resources as running the game in at low settings and 1920x1080. This isn't a big deal on my desktop, but my laptop needs a break to cool down in between games.

The smoke and waving banners is nice, but I don't think I've ever seen the animation from "in queue" to "in champion select" even play properly. It lags or bugs out every time, even on my desktop.

This is all assuming the new champion select stuff is coming over to the new client, but regardless of any changes, I'd prefer a non-animated option. I turn off music and animations where I can because I'm just not interested in the eye candy and very few games have music I'd rather hear than my own playlists.
Though we expect our streamlined animations to be much easier on PCs when we're ready for release, we still intend to support as many potatoes as we can with an animation disable option.

> We still intend to support as many potatoes as we can

For the sake of fellow potatai across the globe, thank you Rito for treating our species well! On Windows I have WAY better FPS than Mac.

i want to add that i hope the animation disable option does not only disable the obvious things like backgrounds and transitions but also things like:
-when i open a chat, the box grows instead of popping up at full size, i dont want the growth animation
-when i open a friend group the names run out of the group button instead of just being there, i dont want the nams unning out animation
-openeing a drop down has the box actually dropping down instead of just instantly being there, i dont want the drop-down animation
...
there are a lot of things like that hidden everywhere, and i would kindly like to inform you, i hate them all and want to disaable ALL of them.
i actually dont mind the animated backgrounds, they look neat. but the other tons of small thingies, i hate them with the heat of a thousand stars.
i know i am late to the discussion, but such is life if you dont live in the u.s. and there are no clues or links in any visible spots about posts like that in time.
best regards

Thanks! It's not as much of an issue on my desktop, but my laptop is one of those fanless ultra light affairs and complains if I stick around in the team creation screen. I'm really looking forward to the update going live :D

You forgot to mention the ability to hear other champions' select quotes, having that re-instated as an option so the majority (who wanted to hear them) can do so with the minority allowed to opt out. 

Please don't forget about this. You guys have said several times that you've heard our cries and will be taking note of this likely being re-implemented. 

Also, in the profile section, many of us have called for customization rather than having our background based off of our "recently played" champion. We'd like to see something about that.

Aside from the previous, the progress you guys are making are quite admirable. Getting more and more excited for this new client.

I've mentioned this in another thread but I think its important enough to repeat. The updated client unlocks the ability for the profile to do much more. I hear you that the recently played champion isn't always ideal, but this actually represents one of those foundational moments where something even that simple was hard to do in the Legacy client and what you see in the updated client is bottled potential.

We are working with feature teams to see how they can really own this page and give it the flourish it needs, but that will likely happen later rather than sooner as we continue to push toward making AIR go to the dead place.
An idea maybe? It would be nice to see the skin of your team in the champ select. Seems like it would not be that hard to switch the icon of the champ into the players skin they choose.
Add Draft Mode Please{{sticker:zombie-nunu-tears}}
That would be great, right now it is almost like being punished for playing the alpha, also you should launch the store next patch no matter what state it's in and just repair it as time goes

Please allow us to buy skins in the new champ select!
I haven't found the win rate in the post game screen. Where can I found the number of games won/lost in ARAM?

I suggest that when you get into like match history and go into details and stuff like that, that riot should add a back button or a home button to go back to the page you were previously on. It kind of gets annoying to have to take so much time to get back to where you were.

>You can't minimize the Friends List.

OH. HELLLLLL. NO.

I don't want this feature "in my face."

Stop forcing "friends" on every solo player that WANTS to play solo.

Quick idea regarding the friendlist : it could be nice to reduce its opacity, and put it back to 100% when we hover it. 

Not sure if it's just me, but I always _want _ to minimize this friendlist because it's a bit too obvious, my eyes just want to look at it for no reason ~~(just like a Taric splah art)~~

Anything that could help focusing on the rest of the client when we are not socializing would be nice!

However I totally understand that minimizing it is a bit useless, and we should get rid of it with the new client.

league of legends is just full of shit!!! aram is the worst thing i played ever in my life. rito u dont care at all about the game and just getting paid for nothing. I want all my years back not knowing about this game and the thing u changed it to. so much dissapointed cant even write it in words. do smth better
The resize thing is kinda important for me as I can't play with the new client. The button to start matchmaking is outside the visible part.

Dear Riot,

please stop forcing us to socialise, some/many people just want to play solo and don't want the friends list to open the whole time, let alone that large. The removal of solo queue hit us hard enough, and should be reverted, since you for one cannot see how many people are premades in each team and secondly, I simply want to have a fair game in which each solo player has the same chances to give proof of his skills. Stop shoving socialising features down our throats, if one wants to see his friendslist all the time, make it optional, that way, everybody feels satisfied. Besides, looking at about every single other gaming platform (Steam, Origin, BattleNet, UPlay, ...), each of those has a friendslist which can be minimised, it is a standard one should not change, LoL is not a social media platform.

Regards
D.P.

PS: Regarding the premade aspect, take a look at Overwatch which after the most recent patch, displays premades perfectly and would allow clarity concerning the fairness of a match. Additionally, when a ranked game reaches the loading screen, you should be able to see each player's rank/MMR, because it gives transperency and most people look up stats like that on 3rd party programs anyway. If you want to improve the game, start with including the most commonly used features of 3rd party websites regarding statistics and general information.
I think it has some issues with NVIDIA Optimus at the moment. Could you please fix it?

my fps ingame is half, and my latency is double. I usually get 400 fps, and 32 ping. is this the client or the servers it runs on? also I think you should be able to disable the music without muting all sound in champ select, and ive also noticed that stats take a long while to show up sometimes.

I don't know if it's the client or my computer but after playing ARAM, the end-game statistics screen didn't show up. I didn't encounter any problem during the gameplay, however, the end-game statistics screen didn't seem to show up after the game. Instead it closes itself. After going back to my Alpha Client, the friend list didn't seem to show any of my friends even though I know my friend's online and I have checked it.

Here's a screenshot of my Alpha Client after the ARAM game:
[Alpha Client Error (Friend Lists)](https://scontent-sit4-1.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t1.0-9/13690712_1379263538758457_5457965369991990787_n.jpg?oh=4f45a26b5227d2a817e6e21e95a03ef5&oe=57EC5EC2)

Based on my first day of the client I have noticed some issues, the fps while entering a lobby for aram/bp is rather laggy, klunky, and unnatural feeling. It doesn't smooth its way in so much so that I thought my client might have froze. I would love to learn how you're going to make it possible for clubs to run just as well as normal drafts

Other than these issues, not being able to access the shop is irking me but I'll live with it.
Ty Riot for letting me test and I hope this feedback is what you're looking for.
